servinfo.title: DTC P0111: Intake Air Temperature Circuit Range / Performance

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Difference of maximum IAT minus minimum IAT is less than 0.3 °C (32.5 °F) while ECT is over 70 °C (158 °F) after 10 min from cold engine start (ECT is lower than 30°C (86 °F) at engine start).

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that following conditions are satisfied when using this “DTC Confirmation Procedure”.

item.ptxt: Intake air temperature at engine start: –10 °C (14 °F) to 80 °C (176 °F)
Engine coolant temperature at engine start: less than 30 °C (86 °F)
Altitude (barometric pressure): 2400 m, 8000 ft or less (560 mmHg, 75 kPa or more)

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch, clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature. (ECT approx. 90 – 95 °C, 194 – 203 °F)
Run engine at idle speed for 10 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: IAT sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ignition switch to ON position.
Check intake air temp. displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Is –40 °C (–40 °F) or 119 °C (246 °F) indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: Wire harness check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect MAF and IAT sensor connector (1) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to MAF and IAT sensor connector (1) at “LT GRN” and “GRY/GRN” wire terminals.
If OK, then with ignition switch turned ON, measure voltage between “LT GRN” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is measured voltage applied to “LT GRN” wire terminal about 4 – 6 V?

testgroup.title: ECM voltage check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “C37-25” terminal.
If OK, then turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between “C37-25” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is voltage about 4 – 6 V at terminal?

paragroup.ptxt: If wire and connection are OK, go to Step 5.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “LT GRN” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “LT GRN” wire is shorted to ground or other circuit.
If wire is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Turn ignition switch to ON position.
Measure voltage between “LT GRN” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “LT GRN” wire shorted to other circuit.
If wire is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “C37-25” terminal of ECM connector and “LT GRN” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector with ignition switch turned OFF.

action.ptxt: “LT GRN” wire is high resistance circuit.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to ECM.
Check for proper connection of MAF and IAT sensor connector at “GRY/GRN” wire terminal.
Measure resistance between “GRY/GRN” wire terminal of MAF and IAT sensor connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned OFF.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Measure resistance between “C37-57” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “GRY/GRN” wire is open or high resistance circuit.
If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check IAT sensor according to Mass Air Flow (MAF) and Intake Air Temperature (IAT) Sensor Inspection .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
